title: Create Game Design Document
purpose: Describe the core function Create Game Design Document.
guardrails: Maintain R&D scope: no full feature implementation or final art.
Use clear structure and headings to organize the GDD.
Cite assumptions and unknowns within each section.
Keep prototypes minimal, focusing on mechanics rather than polish.
Avoid over‑specifying systems not validated by concept phase.
Ensure all deliverables are accessible (e.g., PDFs) and version‑controlled.
Respect intellectual property when using external references; attribute sources.
Adhere to the timeline; revisions should not exceed two iterations.
Engage cross‑discipline feedback early to avoid rework.
Keep documentation objective and measurable to support downstream teams.

tasks.title: Analyze comparable design documents and extract best practices.
tasks.description: Review at least three comparable game design documents to extract best practices on structure, mechanics, and presentation. Summarize lessons learned to inform the new GDD.

deliverables.description: A report summarizing the structure, mechanics, narrative style, user interface, and lessons learned from at least three comparable game design documents with critical analysis and reflections on best practices.

acceptance.text: Reviews at least three comparable game design documents.
Analyzes structure, mechanics, narrative, user interface, and presentation for each.
Identifies best practices, pitfalls, and recommendations.

tasks.title: Define the high-level vision and design pillars for the target game.
tasks.description: Capture the high-level vision and design pillars that will guide all subsequent decisions, ensuring alignment across art, design, and engineering.

deliverables.description: Document listing three to five design pillars that articulate the high-level vision, goals, and constraints of the target game, with succinct descriptions and rationale.

acceptance.text: Lists three to five concise design pillars.
Provides rationale and example scenarios for each pillar.
Reviewed and approved by creative lead.

tasks.title: Draft the core mechanics, rules, and gameplay flow charts.
tasks.description: Define the game's core mechanics and rules, accompanied by flow charts that illustrate state transitions and user interactions.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet specifying at least three core mechanics with rule definitions, state transitions, and gameplay flow diagrams or references.

acceptance.text: Documents at least three core mechanics including inputs, outcomes, and failure states.
Provides rule tables and flow diagrams for each mechanic.
All mechanics align with the defined design pillars.

tasks.title: Outline narrative arcs, character bios, and level progression framework.
tasks.description: Outline the overall narrative arcs, develop character biographies, and define level progression structures to provide context for gameplay and art.

deliverables.description: Document outlining the game's narrative structure (beginning, middle, end), character biographies for at least three primary characters, and a level progression framework with archetypes and pacing rationale.

acceptance.text: Narrative section includes a clear beginning, middle, and end.
Provides biographies for at least three primary characters with motivations and arcs.
Describes level progression framework with at least three archetypes and pacing guidelines.

tasks.title: Develop UI/UX wireframes and stub prototypes to validate feasibility.
tasks.description: Create wireframes and small stub prototypes to validate the feasibility of the proposed user interface and interactions.

deliverables.description: High-fidelity wireframe designs for core menus, HUD, and navigation flows.

acceptance.text: Includes wireframes for at least the main menu, options menu, and HUD overlays.
Demonstrates navigation flow between screens.
Reviewed by UX designer and art director.

deliverables.description: Zipped archive containing at least two stub prototypes implementing UI/UX flows and core mechanics for feasibility testing.

acceptance.text: Includes at least two runnable prototypes.
Prototypes run without major errors in target engine.
Implements key UI flows outlined in wireframes.

tasks.title: Compose an instrumentation and analytics plan.
tasks.description: Define a comprehensive instrumentation strategy including what data to collect, how to capture it, and how to use metrics for iteration.

deliverables.description: Detailed plan documenting analytics events, triggers, data fields, metrics definitions, and privacy considerations for at least five instrumentation events.

acceptance.text: Lists at least five instrumentation events with definitions, triggers, and data fields.
Specifies metrics, dashboards, and reporting cadence.
Addresses privacy and data storage requirements.

tasks.title: Assemble the draft GDD and conduct peer review.
tasks.description: Compile a full draft of the GDD, facilitate a peer review session, capture feedback, and update the document accordingly.

deliverables.description: Comprehensive draft of the game design document including all sections such as pillars, mechanics, narrative, UI, instrumentation, and appendices.

acceptance.text: Covers all required sections including pillars, mechanics, narrative, UI, instrumentation.
Uses clear headings and consistent formatting.
Ready for peer review.

deliverables.description: Structured markdown document capturing peer feedback, questions, and decisions from the review session.

acceptance.text: Captures at least five actionable feedback points.
Includes decisions and owners for each action item.
Published within 24 hours of the review meeting.

deliverables.description: Revised game design document incorporating feedback, clarifications, and updates based on the peer review.

acceptance.text: Addresses all feedback items listed in review notes.
Updates relevant sections while maintaining structure.
Approved by leads after revisions.
